summary: The CARES Act authorized Treasury to provide up to $46 billion in loans to airlines and other aviation businesses affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. The loan program had 267 applications and provided 35 loans worth $21.9 billion. Treasury prioritized applications from the largest passenger airlines—awarding 7 loans for about $20.8 billion. Most applications were from smaller carriers, ticket agents, and other businesses. These took longer...
title: Financial Assistance: Lessons Learned from CARES Act Loan Program for Aviation and Other Eligible Businesses
